definition: to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Good luck, let's hope he is not afraid of hitchhikers.
sentences.chinese: 祝你走运，但愿他不害怕路人搭车。

sentences.english: A friend and I were hitchhiking , but no one would stop.
sentences.chinese: 一次我的一位朋友和我在搭车旅行，可没人车。

sentences.english: Lets go to the station to get a train into town.
sentences.chinese: 我们到水车站往搭车进乡。

sentences.english: Many of these young hitchhikers may come from good families.
sentences.chinese: 这些年轻的搭车客中有好多可能来自于不错的家庭。

sentences.english: A hitchhiker flagged me down on the highway.
sentences.chinese: 司机停下来让一个搭车人上了车。

sentences.english: The drivers topped to pick up a hitchhiker.
sentences.chinese: 司机停下来让一个搭车人上了车。

sentences.english: Can you give me a ride to the station?
sentences.chinese: 你能让我搭车去车站吗？

sentences.english: It is snowing so heavily, you had better go to work by car.
sentences.chinese: 下这么大雪，你还是搭车去上班吧。

sentences.english: I don't belong here. I don't belong there.
sentences.chinese: 再也没有人陪我玩这一场，搭车游戏。

sentences.english: I was always at the trial on Wednesdays, and sometimes I gave you a lift.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是在星期三去那场审判，有时我还给你搭车。

sentences.english: Remember Silverstone '91, when Nigel Mansell gave Ayrton Senna a lift?
sentences.chinese: 还记得91年曼赛尔也给塞纳搭车来着咩？

sentences.english: By the time she reached the bus stop for her homeward trip, her stomach was one big knot.
sentences.chinese: 她走到巴士站，准备搭车回家，肚子又饿得要命。

sentences.english: The student thumbed his way across the country.
sentences.chinese: 这个学生免费搭车跑遍全国。

sentences.english: They took advantage of our friendship just to get a ride to the movies.
sentences.chinese: 他们对我们表示友好仅仅是为了搭车去看电影。

sentences.english: He gave me a lift back home after the party.
sentences.chinese: 晚会结束后，他让我搭车回家。
最明显的解决办法是搭车。

definition: (coll.) to ride in sb else's car to save money/to ride on a train or bus without buying a ticket (fare-dodging)
to sneak in without a ticket/to stow away
to take the car, bus, train etc
to transfer/to change trains, buses etc
